Question: When driving on an unlaned road, where should your vehicle be positioned?

Answers.Answer: Anywhere, so long as you can see what is coming
Close to the centre of the road
As close to the left side of the road as possible

Question: At night, you MUST always dip the headlights on your vehicle when:
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What is the meaning of a yellow broken line painted on the road near the kerb?

Answers.Answer: You may stop for no more than 5 minutes

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does a blue reflector (cat’s eye) placed on the road mean?

Answers.Answer: The left side of the road

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: You may park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign
You may park your vehicle for no longer than 40 minutes from 8am to 6pm on days other than public holidays
You may park your vehicle for longer than 40 minutes if someone stays in it
You may not park your vehicle within the next 40 metres of the sign

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What should you do if an ambulance comes up behind you, flashing red lights or sounding its siren?

Answers.Answer: Put your vehicle hazard lights on and drive on at the same speed
Slow down, pull over and allow the ambulance to pass
Flash your vehicle headlights to warn oncoming traffic

Question: How can small amounts of alcohol affect your driving?

Answers.Answer: You can judge your speed more easily
Your driving reactions will be quicker

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must be displayed on the back of a trailer being towed at night?
When you have a learner licence you must always drive with a supervisor. A supervisor is a person who has held a current and valid licence for a year.
If you tow another vehicle, what is the maximum distance allowed between the two vehicles?
You are the driver of the blue car. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Keep driving as the cyclist has to stop
Stop and give way to the cyclist
Keep driving as the cyclist has to give way to larger vehicles
Sound the warning device to warn the cyclist

Question: When driving at night, which vehicle lights should you turn on?
Your vehicle has a current warrant of fitness but a rear red brake light (stop light) is not working. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Only use the vehicle during daylight hours
Only use the vehicle in a 50km/h speed zone

Question: You must NOT open the door of your motor vehicle when:

Answers.Answer: you are parked within 10 metres of a bus stop
you are likely to scratch the paint of your vehicle
the car radio in your vehicle is playing loud music
you are likely to hurt any person

Question: If you are driving and you want to use a cellphone what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Stop in the flush median to answer calls when it is safe to do so
Answer the call at the next set of traffic signals
Slow down to answer the call when it is safe to do so
Pull over and stop to use the cellphone when it is safe to do so

Question: What does a reflectorised triangle placed on the side of the road mean?
What is the least distance of clear road you MUST have in front of you when you have finished passing another vehicle?
What is the maximum speed you may drive if you have a ‘space saver wheel’ fitted?
If you have a restricted licence you can carry a passenger if they are your spouse.
What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: What is the purpose of the 2-second rule?

Answers.Answer: To provide a safe following distance between vehicles traveling at the same speed
To ensure that vehicles have sufficient stopping time when approaching intersections
To avoid gridlocks in congested driving areas
To ensure the speed limit is observed

Question: When coming up to a one-lane bridge, what does this sign indicate?

Answers.Answer: Others should give way to you

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
You must turn your headlights on when visibility is less than:
This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Question: What is the safest way to drive up to intersections?

Answers.Answer: At such a speed that you can stop if you have to

Question: For what purpose can a vehicle use the flush median strip?

Answers.Answer: To move into the traffic flow

Question: A broken yellow line painted close to the edge of the road means you may stop or park your vehicle there at any time.
When coming to a pedestrian crossing without a raised traffic island, what must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to pedestrians on your side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on the other side of the road
Give way to pedestrians on any part of the crossing
Drive on as pedestrians will give way to all oncoming traffic

Question: If you miss your exit on a motorway, you should:

Answers.Answer: use the flush median strip and reverse back to the exit
make a U-turn back to the exit
drive on to the next exit
slowly stop and reverse back to the exit
